intro: Pourthiaea zollingeri, commonly known as the Zollinger's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common trait among members of its family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
